dcterms:creator: M. Pinedo
dcterms:description: The Job Shop Scheduling Problem (JSSP) is a classic scheduling problem that involves allocating resources to jobs over time to minimize completion time and other criteria.
dcterms:title: Job Shop Scheduling Problem (JSSP)

dcterms:creator: M. Pinedo
dcterms:description: The Flexible Job Shop Scheduling Problem (FJSSP) extends the JSSP by allowing jobs to be processed on multiple machines, providing more flexibility in scheduling.
dcterms:title: Flexible Job Shop Scheduling Problem (FJSSP)

dcterms:creator: C. Zhang
W. Song
Z. Cao
J. Zhang
P. S. Tan
X. Chi
dcterms:description: The 6x6 JSSP instances are specific instances of the Job Shop Scheduling Problem used to evaluate deep reinforcement learning algorithms.
dcterms:title: 6x6 JSSP instances

dcterms:creator: C. Zhang
W. Song
Z. Cao
J. Zhang
P. S. Tan
X. Chi
dcterms:description: The 3x4 tool-constrained JSSP instance is a specific instance of the Job Shop Scheduling Problem that includes constraints related to tool usage.
dcterms:title: 3x4 tool-constrained JSSP instance
